title: Core Capital-Goods Orders Hit A Record High In December
text: New orders for durable goods posted an eighth consecutive gain in December, rising 0.2 percent following a gain of 1.2 percent in November. Durable-goods orders excluding aircraft and parts rose 0.7 percent for the month following 1.1 percent gains in the prior two months.

title: Monetary Inflation Vs. Input Cost Inflation: Fear Input Cost Inflation

title: The Lessons From Markets in 2020, According to Fisher Investments
text: While 2020's awfulness in terms of the pandemic's impact on lives and livelihoods is clear, for markets, the picture was different: 2020 was a wild year, with COVID-related lockdowns driving a steep plunge into a bear market, followed by what Fisher Investments' research shows is a historically unusual recovery—both in terms of its speed and the categories that led. Here is a look inside this wild year in markets—and some investing lessons from 2020 to carry forward.

title: The Three Times the Russell 2000 Outperformed the S&P 500 (and Why They Matter)
text: The Russell 2000 index of small-cap stocks is currently delivering better returns than another benchmark index, the S&P 500. In the three other periods when that was true, the U.S. economy was either entering a recession or about to ride a wave of expansion.

title: Thematic ETFs Could Expose Investors to Greater Risks
text: Thematic exchange traded fund strategies have been a great way to access specific segments of the market and capture new trends, but may also pose unique risks.
